intro: Mangifera austroyunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan mango, is a species native to China, specifically the Yunnan province. It is a small to medium-sized tree that can grow up to 10 meters in height, with smooth, grey bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by edible fruits that are similar in appearance to common mangoes. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in subtropical regions with well-drained soil.
